body.name: Unnatural Death: A Scarpetta Novel
body.description: Two mauled bodies in the woods. Top secret autopsies. The most chilling cases of Scarpetta’s career.In this thrilling new installment of Patricia Cornwell’s #1 bestselling Scarpetta series, chief medical examiner Dr. Kay Scarpetta finds herself in a Northern Virginia wilderness examining the remains of two campers wanted by federal law enforcement.The victims have been savaged beyond recognition, and other evidence is terrifying and baffling, including a larger-than-life footprint.After one of the most frightening body retrievals of her career, Scarpetta must discover who would commit murders this savage, and why. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars One of my Favorite in Series
reviews.reviewText: I thought some of books in the series weren’t up to previous standards, but I think I was wrong. In the last few books I’ve appreciated the temporal dovetailing. The characters have aged, are less volatile (Marino and Lucy), and you see them more as real people, albeit overachievers! The technologies of drone swarms, exoskeletons, and hacking are real and real problems. You want Scarpetta to solve the mundane personnel issues and get newer equipment. I wanted to call the governor and get that troublesome pair run out of the state. Give me more of this wonderful series and make a movie. Any ideas on casting? I’d love to hear about them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Slow start …then a page turner!
reviews.reviewText: Unnatural Death by Patricia CornwellI am a Patricia Cornwell fan. I buy her books as soon as they are on the shelf without reading the cover blurb. I also love Kay Scarpetta and the cast of characters surrounding her. But this book was a bit of a struggle for me in the beginning. I thought the book started slow and didn’t pick up steam until several chapters in. But nobody writes a crime scene like Cornwell. The gore is there but Scarpetta will handle it like the professional she is. The mystery is strong . When Scarpetta suited up to recover a body, I found myself holding my breath. Cornwell has her pulse on the latest technology for crime fighters and criminals and this book is no exception. The terror is real and frightening. The mark of a good crime novelist. I love the way Cornwell uses the weather in her books to up the suspense ante. Sneaking up on the building in the snowy woods was a bit over the top but then again, were the terrorists just too arrogant to have security. Could be. Once Cornwell gets this story going, the pace is fast and furious right through the surprise ending. Kay’s Italian food always plays a part in Scarpetta’s stories and brings warm and cozy feelings when it is prepared and served - maybe even the feelings of a safety net. But readers know in this book, this time, there just might not be a safety net. A four star read for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I've been reading Kay Scarlet tags books from the start and have enjoyed some more than others. Her characters have been developing for years and feel like family.I enjoyed this book as it takes place in the region where Kay first started out and feels familiar. This novel brings the whole "family" together again and throws in some great surprises for her fans. The setting is exotic and enticing and the suspense real. No boring narration. Sure to keep a reader engaged and make a new reader want to go back and start at the beginning to see how these characters got to where they are today.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Probably my last Kay Scarpetta read.
reviews.reviewText: Who knows if Patricia Cornwell is planning another Kay Scarpetta book - I suppose so since the evil Carrie still lives on - but if so I doubt I’ll be reading it. I like the basic Kay, Benton, and Marino characters (although there’s such a thing as one autopsy too many - but not the hypo techno doomsday Cold War scenarios nor the largely improbable plotting that puts these three, plus the (to my eyes) non-credible superwoman Lucy, in key governmental or para governmental positions with their security clearances and high tech baubles and devices. Just finished rereading all the Kinsey Millhone crime novels a and think the late Sue Grafton created a far more human environment for her groundbreaking female investigator.PS someone should tell Cornwell that no one in Italy - where I live - would follow spaghetti bolognese (small b) with panzanella which is made largely of bread AND then garlic bread as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Unnatural Death is the best book of the series
reviews.reviewText: I love this series Always a riveting and exciting story being told Unnatural Death is my favorite so far I just want to keep reading! I'm always sad when the book ends Absolutely love the characters in Kay's life and so well written that I always feel I'm right there with them. Can't wait for the next book!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So glad Scarlett a is still solving mysteries!
reviews.reviewText: I've read all the books and please keep them coming. This one incorporates new technologies that are scary s can be and will be obso!she before you know it. Who can say what. Ones next?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I have been a fan if the Scarpetta series since the first book. Love the stories and how Kay Scarpetta has evolved throughout. I love all the characters that have been developed for this series. The book was very good and I loved the story. But as I mentioned in my headline, there is, once again, no closure to the Carrie issue. Also hopefully, the governor will deal appropriately with Maggie and Dr. Reddy in the next book. They truly deserve whatever is coming at them. But my main concern, and this is not only with this book but with books from other authors, I do not like having the author's political stance thrown in my face. I don't do that to anyone so why should they. I no longer buy books from 4 authors I have follwed for years for that same exact issue. But I always like to give them another chance. And that is why I rated this booka 4 instead of a 5. It's reallysad that author's have to throw their poitical bent into one of their books. To this reader, it is unfair and uncalled for,.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Best book she has written in a while. Enjoyed it! Why didn’t Kay mention the sound she heard in the cave? Could have been a Sasquatch 🤔

Zu Beginn langsam aufgebauter Spannungsbogen der zum Ende hin gehastet aufgelöst wird. Nicht das beste Buch von Patricia Cornwell, aber die letzten Bücher sind eh eher was für Fans .. leider abfallende Tendenz und dieser Band trägt leider dazu bei
loved reading all her books and this one was no exception

reviews.reviewTitle: Science for the future is now
reviews.reviewText: So up to date on science, politics, etc… It is so knowgeable & enjoyable reading Patricia Crownell. A real page turner.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Much more enjoyable than the last book which was far too technical. Clever plot. Hope it's just fiction not reality.
Follows normal formula of Scarpetta books-lots of talk and little action until halfway through and big finish— but entertaining nonetheless.
